abstract: Merrill Lynch reported its earnings Thursday, possibly for the last time as an independent company. On a conference call that was notable mostly for its lack of fireworks, John Thain, Merrill’s chief executive, said he was “optimistic” about the firm’s future as it moved to consummate its merger with Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch reported its earnings Thursday, possibly for the last time as an independent company. On a conference call that was notable mostly for its lack of fireworks, John Thain, Merrill’s chief executive, said he was “optimistic” about the firm’s future as it moved to consummate its merger with Bank of America.
